alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 12:58AM EST until January 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Up to one to two feet of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the lower Neuse River, Pamlico, Core and Back Sounds, and adjacent tidal creeks, and areas along the beaches, Pamlico Sound, and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...Until noon EST today. * IMPACTS...Up to 1 to 2 of inundation above ground level is possible in typically flood prone areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in an elevated threat of property damage. Flooding of very low-lying roads, parking lots and properties possible in and around Ocracoke Village, Downeast Carteret County, and Beaufort. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Beaufort Marine Lab NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.0 ft, Moderate 5.5 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor -0.8 ft, Moderate -0.3 ft, Major 0.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/08 PM 4.0 -1.8 1.4 1 None 04/09 AM 5.8 0.0 1.9 1 Moderate 04/10 PM 4.4 -1.4 1.7 1 None 05/10 AM 5.5 -0.3 1.8 1 Moderate 05/10 PM 4.2 -1.6 1.5 1 None 06/11 AM 5.0 -0.8 1.6 1 Minor Ocracoke Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.0 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.9 ft, Moderate 2.9 ft, Major 4.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/08 PM 3.4 2.3 2.5 3-4 Minor 04/09 AM 3.1 2.0 1.7 2-3 Minor 04/08 PM 2.5 1.4 1.6 1 None 05/09 AM 2.8 1.7 1.5 1-2 None 05/10 PM 2.5 1.4 1.5 1 None 06/10 AM 2.9 1.8 1.7 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
